info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:16AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN RIPLEY COUNTY THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1216 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Greensburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Holton, Napoleon, Millhousen, Versailles Lake, Otter Village, Ballstown and New Marion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
